resources.string: Click on the image to classify

Scroll the respective wheels to:\n(1) Choose a fruit to track its ripeness and remaining lifetime.\n(2) Choose online mode to capture an image or offline mode to choose a ready pair of images for reconstruction, useful for phones without an NIR camera.

We have three different applications that we have worked on: Organic classification (Apples, Kiwi, Blueberries), Olive Oil Adulteration, Kiwi Organic Classification. Scroll the wheel and select any of the applications.\nChoose which mode you\'d like to test the application on: Offline Mode lets the user use pre-existing images to be used in our models, It will also enable the user to test our model on android phones which do not have a NIR camera (by using our own provided images). So pressing it will allow the user to run the app and on the next page will require the user to input two images (RGB and NIR).

Clicking the camera capture button captures both RGB and NIR image, back to back, to make it easy to align the two images.\nThe camera will not capture photo if the lighting conditions are not adequate.

Swipe through the two RGB and NIR images.\nTap on any part of the image to get a 64 * 64 bounding box which will be used for reconstruction (not tapping anywhere will use the whole image).\nFirst Tap will place the bounding box directly in the middle, tap again to place it anywhere on the image you want.

Swipe through the two RGB and NIR images. Tap on any part of the image to get a 64 * 64 bounding box which will be used in the Reconstruction phase. Tap to use a patched image, not tapping anywhere will use the whole image for Spectral Reconstruction.\nFirst Tap will place the bounding box directly in the middle, Tap again to place it anywhere on the image you want.

Swipe through the reconstructed Hypercube bands.
Tap on the "Analysis" button to show the signature at a particular pixel.
While on the "Analysis" page Long Tap on the GraphView to go back to the original page.
Tap anywhere on any pixel to get its signature to be run through the classifier.
Tap and Hold to show a new signature and delete all other persistent signature analysis.
Swipe through the reconstructed Hypercube bands.\nIn the simple mode, the application just checks the signature of the middle pixel.
